headline: Acen Australia’s 400MW Stubbo Solar project reaches full commercial operation
summary_80w: Acen Australia has achieved full commercial operation at its 400MW Stubbo Solar project in New South Wales, making it the first solar PV power plant backed by a Long-Term Energy Service Agreement (LTESA) to reach this milestone.

headline: Australia mandates three-hour free solar electricity for households from 2026
summary_80w: The Australia government will require energy retailers to provide free solar electricity to households during peak daytime generation periods.

headline: Building trust through action: How social license will shape the future of energy storage
summary_80w: Marie Cullen, head of procurement at Fluence Australia, explains how social licensing could become a key component for the future of energy storage developments.

headline: ContourGlobal closes first US solar project financing for 324MW Colorado project
summary_80w: IPP ContourGlobal has closed its first renewable energy project financing in the US, as it continues to expand its presence in the country.

headline: Victoria approves 2,200MWh of battery storage through streamlined pathway in Australia
summary_80w: The Victoria government in Australia has approved a 300MW/1,200MWh BESS in Gippsland and a 332MW solar PV power plant with integrated storage in the state's northeast region.

headline: Battery energy storage deployment in Australia’s NEM surges 150% year-on-year, says AEMO
summary_80w: Battery storage capacity in Australia's National Electricity Market (NEM) expanded by 2,936MW/6,482MWh over the 12 months leading to the end of Q3 2025.

headline: EnergyRe bags US$370 million for South Carolina PV projects
summary_80w: US renewables developer EnergyRe has reached financial close on a solar PV portfolio in the US state of South Carolina.

headline: Australia: Sun Energy’s 132MW Merredin solar PV plant leads performance ranking in October
summary_80w: Solar developer Sun Energy’s 100MW Merredin solar project in Western Australia has been the best-performing PV plant in October 2025, according to data from research firm Rystad Energy.

headline: Runergy develops 26.55% efficient M10 TOPCon solar cell
summary_80w: Runergy has reported that its latest n-type TOPCon solar cell has achieved a conversion efficiency of 26.55%.

headline: The Solar PV industry needs to step up to face major challenges in sourcing and transparency
summary_80w: Dr KT Tan, CTO at Viridian Solar, chronicles how the expansion of solar raises questions about supply chain transparency and ethical sourcing.

headline: Illinois: Advocates, industry welcome clean energy legislation that includes 3GW energy storage target
summary_80w: The Illinois General Assembly’s passing of a major energy bill, including a 3GW energy storage target, has been welcomed by environmental advocacy groups and trade associations.

headline: France introduces grid tariff reforms for energy storage
summary_80w: From August 2026, energy storage projects in France will benefit from changes to grid tariffs designed to encourage them to support the grid at specific times of the day.

headline: ‘Silver buckshot, not a silver bullet’: the rally cry for Australia’s energy storage strategy
summary_80w: A “silver buckshot, not a silver bullet" has emerged as the rallying cry for Australia's energy storage, said Paul Hunyor of Wollemi Capital.

headline: EBRD provides US$142 million for Uzbekistan’s first gigawatt-scale solar PV and energy storage portfolio

headline: Meta signs 385MW solar offtake agreements for data centre
summary_80w: US independent power producer (IPP) Treaty Oak Clean Energy has signed two environmental attribute purchase agreements (EAPA) with social media and data giant Meta.

headline: Australia’s solar PV and storage sectors drive record Q3 2025 performance
summary_80w: Australia's solar and energy storage sectors delivered transformative performance during the third quarter of 2025, with grid-scale solar generation reaching 1,699MW average output while battery systems expanded capacity by 2,936MW since Q3 2024.

headline: Acen Australia commits to recycling one million modules from 400MW solar PV power plant
summary_80w: Acen Australia has committed to recycling around one million solar modules from its 400MW Stubbo solar PV power plant in New South Wales.

headline: Eku Energy, LP Renewables propose 1,600MWh Belah BESS in Queensland, Australia
summary_80w: Developer Eku Energy and LP Renewables have announced plans for the 400MW/1,600MWh Belah battery energy storage system in Queensland, Australia.

headline: What does the upcoming Section 232 on polysilicon need to answer?
summary_80w: Solar Media Market Research looks into the the Section 232 ruling in the US, tackling the questions that need to be understood.

headline: First Solar to open new 3.7GW US manufacturing plant in 2026

headline: Flatiron Energy upsizes credit facility to US$250 million for BESS portfolio

headline: Wisconsin utilities opt for solar-plus-storage project acquisitions over ‘debt-like PPAs’

headline: Global net zero ‘impossible’ by 2050, Wood Mackenzie says

headline: Enphase revenues rise, tariffs impact margin in Q3
